Insight Global is hiring an Aircraft Operations Coordinator to support our client in Great Falls, MT. This role is responsible for coordinating, planning, organizing, and overseeing the readiness and release of MH-139 aircraft.

The coordinator will manage operational activities during assigned shifts to ensure alignment with the daily flight schedule. A high level of subject matter expertise is essential, including the ability to review aircraft documentation, validate Aircraft/Engine Logbook entries, and oversee operational control responsibilities. Candidates should have prior experience in aviation support and be familiar with the Exceptional Release process. The role also includes verifying aircraft status to ensure all required actions are completed accurately.

The standard schedule is 1st shift (7:00 AM – 3:30 PM), with availability required for 2nd or 3rd shift as needed.

This pivotal role involves the development of innovative power converters and power electronics-based equipment designs for HVDC transmission, DC grid architectures, and FACTS, ensuring optimal integration with the control and the broader power system. The successful candidate will report to the Valve Converter Electrical Team Leader and collaborate with the power electronics valves product manager and world-class experts within the HVDC converter valve team to deliver innovative converter valve products that positively impact the business.
The role gives an excellent opportunity for a motivated candidate to innovate, expand their design skill and personal development within a globally recognized expert team in HVDC and FACTS. The candidate will play a major role in technical decisions and design and innovation phases. It also involves internal interactions with other HVDC engineering functions and other businesses, but also external interactions with HVDC customers, 3rd party companies such as test laboratories, standard committees, universities and so on.
Responsibilities:
• Design, model, and analyze converter topologies (VSC, MMC) and components.
• Validate performance through simulations, prototyping, and testing.
• Develop requirement, design, and test specifications; ensure compliance with standards.
• Lead innovation in HVDC/FACTS products; document results via patents and publications.
• Mentor engineers; manage development activities and participate in design reviews.
• Support control and system design teams for integrated solutions.
• Develop sizing and design tools; ensure EMI compliance and robust converter design.
• Engage with customers, test labs, universities, and standard committees.

• Doctorate degree in an Engineering field with a minimum of 8 years of experience in design, development and validation of power converters or master’s degree in an Engineering field with a minimum of 15 years of experience in design, development, and validation of power converters.
• Minimum of 5 years’ experience in development of complex power converters of >1MVA for grid or industrial applications (e.g., HVDC converter, HVDC multiterminal scheme, Wind/Solar converter, STATCOM, multi-level inverters, Rectifiers, Filters, Drives, etc)

description:
An employer is looking for an Electrical Engineer in the Huntsville, AL area. As a part of the Hardware Engineering team's design efforts working within an Agile environment. Your core tasks will entail developing and maintaining Electrical drawings for multiple Ground Systems (GS) IPT hardware systems and their interfaces with facilities. Under the direction of your program leadership, responsibilities include performing analyses IAW industry and military standards, developing rack/system level drawings, maintaining drawings PLM system, evaluating hardware design efforts, scheduling, and planning required tasks, leading small teams, and writing reports to support milestone reviews. Accountability and active participation in team meetings and internal/external demos, and documenting progress on team dashboards is expected.
Responsible for overseeing and coordinating electrical systems design
Evaluating electrical systems, products, components, and applications by reviewing designs.
Ensures product quality by reviewing electrical designs and validating that current standards are applied.
Supports the delivery of Electrical Systems design Technical Data Packages, as-built TDPs, PDPs, interface models, and additional design artifacts
Supporting structured trade studies to evaluate alternative design solutions to resolve technical issues
Developing and presenting design change requests, coordinating with impacted internal and external stakeholders, and ensuring configuration control of the technical baseline.
Identifying risks and opportunities associated with or driven by design factors and executing handling/mitigation/capture actions to reduce risk or realize opportunities.
Developing and maturing System designs that meet Weapon System requirements, MIL-STD, and other applicable codes and regulations.
Developing system level block diagram, intraconnect/interconnect design and cable harness design.
Support reviews of System Performance Specification, PIDS, HRS, and other artifacts via DOORS in a controlled classified area.

They will be traveling from NOB, NNSY, and NNS to support various submarines. The candidate is required to have an active clearance or an interim clearance due to the nature of the work.

Insight Global is looking for an experienced Outside Machinist with a secret clearance and marine knowledge/background. Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
- Will be assigned on a submarine either at NNS, NNSY, or Chesapeake shop

-They will be doing overhaul work and not new construction
-Will install hatches and covers
-Will also need to grind, prep, and paint

A client of Insight Global is seeking a Cybersecurity Penetration Tester to work 100% onsite at Aberdeen, MD in support of a defense program. This role requires an active DoD Secret clearance and the ability to obtain and maintain a TS/SCI clearance. The successful candidate will join a specialized team conducting manual technical cybersecurity assessments across devices, products, web applications, networks, and software systems. Daily responsibilities include identifying vulnerabilities and exploits using tools like Wireshark and Burp Suite, interpreting network traffic, and performing penetration testing in secure SCIF lab environments. Candidates must have at least 5 years of experience in cybersecurity assessments or penetration testing, with strong knowledge of Linux and Windows internals, networking protocols, and hypervisor virtualization platforms such as VMware, VirtualBox, and ESXi.

$50/hr to $70/hr.

Exact compensation may vary based on several factors, including skills, experience, and education.

Benefit packages for this role will start on the 31st day of employment and include medical, dental, and vision insurance, as well as HSA, FSA, and DCFSA account options, and 401k retirement account access with employer matching. Employees in this role are also entitled to paid sick leave and/or other paid time off as provided by applicable law.

• You will provide premium-tier technical support for Email Security Technologies to customers, partners, account teams, and other engineers.

• You can effectively utilize moderate to complex lab setups to recreate and solve problems.
• United States public sector customers have specific location and citizenship requirements, necessitating a clearance.
• You possess the ability to quickly analyze and understand complex technical environments and use evidence-based troubleshooting to narrow down the scope of a problem in search of a resolution.
Role and Responsibilities
• Provide advanced technical troubleshooting and problem resolution for security products and services, ensuring timely resolution of customer issues.
• Act as a subject matter expert (SME) for public sector customers, addressing their needs and coordinating seamlessly with internal teams to resolve complex challenges.
• Ensure all technical solutions and engagements comply with relevant federal security policies and procedures.
• Reproduce and solve customer issues leveraging on-site and virtual labs.

Insight Global is seeking a Windows Systems Administrator based in Dahlgren, Virginia, to deliver technical assistance and provide solutions for common failures through customer support. This Windows Systems Administrator must have an active Secret Clearance, IAT Level 2 Certification, Security+, and a high school diploma. This role requires 4+ years' experience troubleshooting hardware, software, and other network related issues. This role also requires strong expertise in installing, maintaining, and managing computer systems within LAN/WAN environments, as well as proficiency in workstation configuration. This Windows Systems Administrator will provide hardware support for Intel Core-based PCs, telecommunications equipment, laser printers, overhead projectors, and Common Access Cards (CAC). They must have experience supporting Microsoft-supported Windows Operating Systems, Microsoft Office Suite, and specialized engineering and scientific development tools. Responsibilities include performing system upgrades, installing new software releases, and deploying patches to resolve software-related issues and Information Assurance Vulnerabilities (IAVs). This candidate will monitor and maintain the ServiceNow platform and mailbox to ensure timely responses to user assistance requests. They will respond to inquiries regarding installation, configuration, and customization of assigned products on Windows 11 computers and manage support requests through ServiceNow using established Incident Ticket and Change Request processes. A strong understanding of Active Directory, Security Technical Implementation Guides (STIGs), Risk Management Framework (RMF), and Windows operating systems currently support by Microsoft is essential, along with familiarity with Linux operating systems. Additional responsibilities include creating monthly status reports, maintaining data files, and overseeing system configurations to ensure data integrity. The candidate must also collaborate with Information System Security Officer (ISSO) to obtain system accreditation and ensure compliance with DoD security accreditation procedures and networking standards. Strong analytical, communication, customer service, and teamwork skills are critical. The salary for this role ranges from $75,000-$80,000, depending on experience.

Insight Global is seeking a skilled Technical Writer to work fully on-site in support of one of our large federal clients on a growing DoD contract. The ideal person would alleviate the discrepancies between sub-contractor and prime contractor deliverables as well as the perception of missing quality control functions being performed on deliverables before reaching the government. Job responsibilities would include, but are not limited to:
• Substantive/developmental editing: Evaluating the overall structure, flow, and completeness of documents to ensure it achieves its purpose for the target audience.
• Copy editing: Refining language for clarity, correcting specialized terminology, and ensuring strict adherence to style guides (i.e. IEEE, AP, or Army/DoW standards).

• Technical verification: Cross-checking data, formulas, and diagrams against SME source material to prevent performance risks caused by incorrect or incomplete instructions.
• Software QA documentation: Editing of Test Plans, test cases, and Traceability Matrices to ensure requirements are testable and unambiguous (i.e. SMART).
• Developer documentation: Review of API documentation, SDK guides, and system architecture diagrams to ensure technical accuracy for the engineering or operator audience.

Compensation while on contract: $40/hr - $75/hr

DAY TO DAY: Our client is looking for experienced Security Officers to join their growing team! The Security Officer II role involves carrying out security tasks with professionalism and positivity, interacting with the public, patients, employees, and administrators. This role responds to various types of calls, offering help in both emergency and non-emergency situations. The officer investigates and records safety hazards, incidents, and criminal activities, both electronically and in writing. They patrol specified areas to ensure the safety of the public, patients, employees, and property. They are held accountable by the department's hierarchy for their initiative, judgment, and overall competence in performing tasks, responding to service calls, and carrying out everyday duties. They actively contribute to exceptional customer service and take responsibility for maintaining respectful relationships with everyone. The position necessitates successful completion and clearance from physiological and physical fitness screenings.

As a proactive security officer, you are assigned to specific areas where you perform critical tasks to maintain safety standards. Your duties include:

1. Patrolling and Vigilance:

* Regularly patrolling designated areas to ensure a visible security presence.

* Performing security-related tasks, such as checking doors and monitoring activity.

* Investigating any suspicious activity or individuals.

2. Reporting and Communication:

* Reporting hazards, unusual circumstances, or suspicious incidents to the Security Operations Center.

* Keeping your supervisor informed about any noteworthy activities or events.

* Responding promptly to varying levels of vulnerability, including life-threatening situations and natural disasters.

3. Emergency Response:

* Acknowledging and appropriately handling emergency, non-emergency, and alarm calls.

* Safely assessing alarm causes and providing assistance or direction as needed.

* Administering initial first aid based on your training level.

4. Fire Safety and Prevention:

* Responding to fire alarms during drills and actual incidents.

* Conducting helicopter fire prevention assessments and responding to helicopter fires.

* Maintaining effective communication with supervisors and fellow officers.

5. Conflict Resolution and Physical Management:

* De-escalating disputes between individuals using verbal techniques.

* Physically managing combative or violent persons when necessary (following annual aggression management training).

6. Enforcement and Assistance:

* Enforcing hospital rules and regulations within your assigned area.

* Assisting visitors with directions and information.

* Safely escorting people or property to desired destinations.

7. Investigation and Documentation:

* Interviewing and investigating individuals involved in suspicious or illegal activities.

* Documenting safety hazards, incidents, and criminal activities.

* Reporting findings to Security Administration and law enforcement.

8. Additional Duties:

* Participating in approved activities beyond security operations (e.g., morgue transport, fire extinguisher checks).

* Detaining unauthorized individuals as defined by policy or state law.

Conducting annual security assessments for individual hospital properties.

Insight Global is seeking a highly motivated Research Physicist with a strong background in optics to conduct cutting-edge research in advanced optical materials, nonlinear optics and high-power laser physics to support a federal customer in Washington DC. A successful candidate will work as part of a collaborative team of scientist, inventing and innovating novel solutions to the most challenging problems facing naval science and technology. Their day to day will include but not be limited to:
• Contributing to the design, development, integration, test and evaluation of pulsed, state-of-the-art, solid-state, visible, near and mid-infrared High-Energy Laser (HEL) technology for government customers.
• Evaluating gain material, dopant identity and concentration, and heat spreading material for use in HELs, improved gain media mounting architecture through an iterative development procedure, using interferometry, far field beam quality and nearfield wavefront sensing to optimize the laser output.
• Designing, building and operating several vacuum chambers to support the development of HEL technology; vacuum systems built to explore ion beam polishing and material bonding, house lasers and house process monitoring systems as well as provide materials characterization.
• Developing and maintaining several home-built software tools for HEL development in Python and Matlab to analyze metrology data and to track system configuration, damage and performance.
• Studying extensively the reactivity of chemical warfare agents on surface-deposited, novel metal oxide cluster compositions for practical use in combat areas.

$60/hr to $69/hr.

Exact compensation may vary based on several factors, including skills, experience, and education.

The Subcontractor Management is responsible for overseeing the cost, schedule, technical performance, and risk posture of major subcontracted scope within a defense/aerospace program. description:
Insight Global is looking for a System Administrator II specialized in Big IP F5, for a government contract. These individuals will be working on a military base doing all network and system support for all of the Air Force.

The day to day is as follows:
-Operate, maintain, monitor F5 appliances, configurations, identify BIG-IP Traffic Processing Objects, and analyze overall health and effectiveness of multiple Big IP F5 instances.
-Manage application integration designs around application logic and authentication configuration (session management, application redirects, rewrites, migration scenarios, app routing, CAC/PIV authentication).
-Support, troubleshoot and configure SSL intercept/inspection, web certificates, certificate management, PKI Certificate Authority (CA) bundles, private/public keys. Install, configure, and administer Big IP F5 Platform Suite referencing Web Applications with Local Traffic Manager (LTM) and Access Policy Manger (APM) services.
Install and patch Big IP F5 systems, and document DISA Security Technical Implementation Guidelines (STIGs) checklists.
-Design and administrator load balancing strategies/ techniques, in application switching / traffic management, knowledge of persistence and SSL certificates.
-Create and maintain documentation detailing architecture components, configurations, monitoring & alerting setup, troubleshooting guides, and checklists.
-Notify appropriate Information Technical Equipment Custodian (ITEC) or Property Custodian (PC), in writing, within 4 hours for all accountable item moves.
-Neatly bundle and conceal all excess system or peripheral cabling after each installation or repair.

description:
Our customer is seeking a Construction Manager for Military Construction (MILCON) projects to oversee all field construction operations for military projects that integrate advanced technologies with conventional trades and materials to deliver full-scale projects, from site development through finish out. This position ensures that construction activities are executed safely, efficiently, and in strict accordance with DoD, USACE, and NAVFAC requirements.
The Construction Manager serves as the on-site authority for field execution—responsible for managing daily operations, enforcing contract compliance, implementing safety and quality programs, supervising field teams and subcontractors, and ensuring all milestones are achieved per the government contract.
This role requires deep familiarity with military construction protocols, field management practices, security and safety programs (EM 385-1-1), and the ability to lead a complex construction site in partnership with contracting officers, design professionals, and internal technical, design, and program management teams.

Key Responsibilities

Direct all field construction activities, ensuring compliance with project plans, technical specifications, and all applicable Unified Facilities Criteria (UFC) and Unified Facilities Guide Specifications (UFGS).
Maintain daily coordination with government inspectors, Contracting Officer Representatives (CORs), and base facility managers.
Manage day-to-day construction sequencing, manpower, equipment deployment, material deliveries, and subcontractor performance.
Lead weekly coordination and safety meetings, producing formal field reports, manpower logs, and schedule updates.
Enforce site security protocols, including Anti-Terrorism/Force Protection (AT/FP) standards and controlled area access requirements.
Implement and oversee the Site-Specific Safety and Health Plan (SSHP) per EM 385-1-1 and ensure compliance with DoD and USACE safety requirements.
Support and oversee the Three-Phase Quality Control System (Preparatory, Initial, Follow-Up) in accordance with USACE/NAVFAC QC standards.
Ensure accurate field documentation, inspections, and testing reports per federal requirements.
Verify adherence to FAR and DFARS clauses applicable to MILCON projects.
Track and report potential scope changes, field directives, and unforeseen conditions.
Supervise and mentor field staff and lead subcontractor coordination meetings.
Maintain and update the Integrated Master Schedule and support budget tracking and cost-to-complete projections.
Provide recurring progress reports and executive briefings summarizing field status and risk mitigation strategies.

7+ years of field construction management experience on large-scale DoD, USACE, NAVFAC, or MILCON projects.
Bachelor’s degree in Construction Management, Engineering, Architecture, or related discipline.
Strong knowledge of UFC, UFGS, FAR, DFARS, USACE/NAVFAC QC procedures, EM 385-1-1, and AT/FP standards.

Seeking a Systems Administrator to join a high-performing team at the heart of an important US government function which helps the nation meet its national security strategy. This position requires system admin skills knowledgeable in VM concepts, and the ability to learn a new system and provide requisite feedback. The successful candidate must have multitasking abilities, problem-solving skills, good verbal skills, and most importantly a positive, can-do attitude. The team works in a cross-domain environment with established procedures and controls in a high-stress environment.

Responsibilities include, ensuring maximum system availability, maintain a very high visibility system, follow engineering instructions to conduct system updates/upgrades in coordination with the ISP and the support factory, typical system administration functions, conduct VM-based services to ensure system operation, support development/modification of technical documentation, and complete and track lessons learned and metrics.

The datacenter SME will have a deep technical foundation in virtualization, enterprise storage, and infrastructure architecture. The ideal candidate will not only be an expert in their technical domains but also possess a broad systems perspective, understanding how computing, storage, network, security, and cloud platforms integrate within a modern IT enterprise environment. This role supports critical infrastructure for mission systems, and the SME will serve as a trusted advisor to engineering teams, program leadership, and customer stakeholders.

This role is 100% onsite.

Technical Expertise & Leadership:
· Design, implement, and optimize complex virtualization environments (VMware vSphere, Microsoft Hyper-V, etc.)
· Architect and support enterprise-grade SAN/NAS solutions (e.g., NetApp, Dell EMC, Pure Storage, etc.)
· Lead the migration and consolidation of legacy workloads into virtual or hyperconverged platforms
· Provide Tier 3 support and root cause analysis for complex virtualization and storage incidents
Systems Integration & Architecture:
· Bridge technical silos by analyzing and integrating infrastructure across datacenter compute, network, storage, and cloud
· Support hybrid architectures involving on-prem, edge, and public/private cloud (AWS, Azure, etc.)

· Advise on long-term data center modernization, virtualization roadmap, and cloud readiness
· Evaluate and recommend emerging technologies in software-defined infrastructure and AI-driven operations
· Interface with cybersecurity, DevOps, and application teams to ensure alignment and performance across layers

***********************Alternate Skillset for Position 2 – Business Intelligence (BI) Developer**************************
Position Title: Journeyman or Senior BI Engineer
Labor Category: Data Engineer
Location: Hybrid position in Herndon, VA (Up to 3 days in office)
Clearance Required: Must have minimum Interim SECRET to start

Job Responsibilities:
We are seeking a Business Intelligence (BI) Software Engineer to support a United States Government program. The BI Engineer will be a member of the engineering group. Our team is chartered with providing the skills and innovative technologies to design, develop, produce, and sustain product lines while providing a decisive advantage to our customer’s missions.
The BI developer position will be in Herndon, VA. The candidate will be responsible for analysis, gathering requirements, design, development, testing, and documentation to build reports based on customer requests using BI software (such as Tableau, Power BI, OAS, etc.). The candidate will analyze requirements, implement technical solutions, and collaborate with external customers, partners, and internal team members during the software development life cycle to ensure software standards are met.
The candidate will be a team player and will be expected to manage and complete their tasks in a fast-paced, results-driven environment. Candidates should also have a strong desire to learn and apply emerging technologies such as AWS Cloud and Generative AI (GenAI) to enhance business intelligence and report development capabilities.

Basic Qualifications:
• 3-9 (Journeyman Level) or 9+ (Senior Level) years of experience and BS or equivalent in Computer Science or related technical field
• Experience with installation, configuration, and administration of Tableau and other BI tools
• Designs/develops complex reports and dashboards using BI tools (Tableau, OAS, etc.)
• Translate reporting requirements into reporting models, visualizations, and reports with a strong understanding of enterprise architecture
• Integrate dashboards and reports from a variety of sources (Oracle, Redshift, Flat Files, etc.), ensuring adherence to data quality, usability, and business rule standards

Direct all daily jobsite operations, including oversight of subcontractors, field staff, equipment, deliveries, and sequencing.

description:
Insight Global is seeking a hands-on Maintenance & Operations Technician with the capability and technical maturity to step into a lead-level role supporting F‑16 Mission Tactics Trainer (MTT) simulators. Prior leadership experience is not required—this role is ideal for an experienced technician who is ready to move into a working‑lead position while still remaining deeply hands-on. This position supports high‑fidelity F‑16 training devices used by the Air National Guard. The technician will work onsite at Hill AFB and collaborate closely with the site’s technical leadership structure. Candidates must be local to the Hill AFB area or willing to relocate. The technician will report to a remote lead technician, who reports to the program manager.

Key Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Leadership & Coordination
- Serve as a working lead for daily simulator operations and maintenance tasks.
- Assist with scheduling, workflow coordination, and ensuring coverage for operational hours.
- Provide input on contractor performance and support onboarding and training of new technical staff.
- Support a collaborative, safety-focused work environment aligned with base requirements.

Technical Operations
- Perform operation, maintenance, troubleshooting, and repair of F‑16 simulator systems and subsystems.
- Support daily readiness checks, startup/shutdown procedures, initialization, and Distributed Mission Operations (DMO) activities.
- Diagnose complex hardware, software, electronic, and network issues.

* Stay at the forefront of industry advancements, emerging technologies, and regulatory standards related to RF, EW, and threat simulation, proactively integrating them into system designs and deployments.

* Assist and drive development of comprehensive technical documentation, including installation guides, user manuals, and advanced troubleshooting procedures, to empower customers and internal stakeholders.

The Senior Survivability Engineer leads efforts to ensure CUAS platforms remain resilient and operational in contested and evolving threat environments. This role involves defining protective technology requirements, coordinating with intelligence and OEMs, and safeguarding critical program information (CPI) through export controls and system assurance. The engineer conducts trade studies to evaluate radar, missile, and C2 system capabilities for enhanced survivability and security. They oversee system architecture to ensure it meets robust security and scalability standards, while managing technical risks across cost, schedule, and performance. Responsibilities include creating key documentation such as Program Protection Plans and Security Classification Guides, and ensuring compliance with system security best practices. The role requires deep technical expertise in system security engineering, protective technologies, and cyber resilience, along with strong leadership and communication skills. As a strategic partner to the PMO and other defense entities, the engineer influences program direction and supports threat assessments and system updates to improve survivability.

Act, either as a part of the team or independently, to uncover and resolve issues associated with the development and implementation of test products

The Electro-Mechanical Assembly Technician is responsible for the production, integration, installation, and testing of electro-mechanical subassemblies and rack-based systems used in defense and industrial applications. This position involves hands-on mechanical and electrical assembly, cable routing, troubleshooting to component level, and system acceptance testing in accordance with engineering drawings, schematics, work instructions, and technical documentation. The technician ensures all equipment meets established quality and configuration standards and supports the development of installation and testing instructions for fielded systems.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
• Assemble and integrate subassemblies into complete rack-based systems and enclosures.
• Perform mechanical assembly using hand tools, power tools, soldering equipment, and fixtures; align and secure components.
• Route and secure cables and harnesses inside electro-mechanical equipment racks in accordance with layout and configuration requirements.
• Test and repair subassemblies, cables, and components to board or device level; basic electronics troubleshooting required.
• Work from schematics, mechanical drawings, blueprints, written procedures, diagrams, and technical orders.
• Perform Acceptance Test Procedures (ATPs) using test equipment such as oscilloscopes, digital multimeters, and network test devices.
• Install hardware, cabling, and subassemblies and conduct final acceptance testing on completed rack systems.
• Prepare work records, test documentation, and configuration verification forms.
• Inspect parts, hardware, and assemblies for workmanship and surface defects.

Insight Global is looking for a ColdFusion Developer to join one of their clients in New York City. This person will be responsible for, ensuring that the Law School’s legacy ColdFusion applications remain secure and functional as the university starts to get rid of LDAP authentication. Your primary focus will be on transitioning these systems to modern authentication methods, either by reworking ColdFusion modules to support SAML or by implementing a reverse application proxy that integrates with OAuth/SAML and enforces secure headers for authorization. This work will involve analyzing existing codebases, updating shared libraries, and validating that applications continue to operate reliably throughout the transition. Beyond authentication, you will manage critical infrastructure components such as Windows Server environments, load balancers, SSL certificate management, and multi-factor authentication. You will also contribute to ongoing migration efforts as applications are gradually moved to modern platforms like Salesforce, and .NET, while documenting workflows and providing support to ensure requirements are met. Day-to-day responsibilities will include balancing urgent short-term fixes with longer-term planning, participating in sprints using project management tools such as Linear, and applying CI/CD practices. You will also have to run daily/ every other day scrum calls to ensure alignment on the work being completed.

Insight Global is seeking a Simulation Systems Engineer to support a federal client part-time in Suffolk, VA. The Systems Engineer must have a strong Modeling and Simulation (M&S) background. This person will support the client with remote work and occasional visits to the customer’s Suffolk, VA Joint Staff Complex.

The successful candidate will provide direct support to the government customer, leveraging deep expertise in JLVC Federation M&S systems to create comprehensive MBSE models. You will be a key driver of innovation, using Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning (AI/ML) and subject matter expertise to conceive and develop rapid M&S prototype solutions that further the modernization and standardization of JLVC training capabilities across the Department of War (DoW). This role requires a strategic thinker with a proven track record of architecting and integrating complex systems to solve critical warfighter challenges.

Essential Job Responsibilities

· Conduct in-depth research to create and maintain a comprehensive MBSE model of the JLVC Federation, defining its architecture, tracking testing, and enabling more rapid and reliable federation iterations.

· Lead efforts to capture, build, and track JLVC Modernization requirements, supporting the metrics team to ensure progress aligns with strategic goals.

· Collaborate with the JLVC Modernization engineering and development teams to design and conceive rapid prototypes of cutting-edge capabilities.

· Serve as a primary consultant on JSJ7 requirements for next generation wargaming tools, including the integration of the Army's NEXGEN Constructive (NGC) simulation capabilities.

· Support the requirements definition, development, and testing for the MAVEN Smart System JLVC data layer and the JTT application.

· Provide strategic consulting on the implementation of generative AI capabilities into training frameworks to accelerate work production and enhance collaboration.

· Travel quarterly to Suffolk, VA (if remote) and to M&S technology partner sites as required to facilitate collaboration and program success.

$59/hr to $62/hr.

Insight Global is seeking a junior electrical engineer to join our team for an exciting opportunity to work on a unique government contract. The contract assists in acquisition and technical sustainment engineering and will augment government resources. As a Nuclear Hardness Junior Electrical Engineer, you will work on a high-performing team to provide engineering, technical, and administrative expertise to the government to maintain their nuclear hardness program in accordance with requirements detailed in Department of Defense, United States Strategic Command, and Air Force directives, manuals and instructions, ensuring the weapon system remains a reliable and effective nuclear deterrent. Nuclear hardness is defined as the ability of a system or any of its elements to withstand exposure to one or more effects of a hostile nuclear environment.

A client of Insight Global is seeking an ISSE to support a large Army program. We are seeking a highly skilled Information Systems Security Engineer (ISSE) to lead hands-on implementation of configuration management (CM) tools and security controls in a hybrid cloud environment. This role is 75% technical execution and 25% documentation, with a dedicated RMF specialist handling most compliance tasks. Early deliverables include researching and implementing CM tools, conducting R&D to determine appropriate security controls, and building CI/CD pipelines from scratch with strong automation. Success will be measured by delivering finalized tool recommendations within six months and a working prototype with usage documentation by twelve months. The ISSE will collaborate closely with developers, security engineers, and program managers to secure OpenStack-based infrastructure through network segmentation, identity management, encryption, and container security (Docker/Kubernetes). Responsibilities include heavy scripting (Python, Bash, PowerShell), Linux hardening and troubleshooting, patch management using Landscape and Satellite, and dashboard creation in Prometheus/Grafana. Candidates should hold at least Security+ (CISSP/CASP preferred) and bring journeyman-to-expert Linux expertise. This position supports the development of a new Software Engineering Environment for the APG Software Engineering Center, with potential to become the Army-wide standard.

Insight Global is looking for a Secret Information Systems Security Engineer (ISSE) for one of our federal clients in Albuquerque, NM. The Information Systems Security Engineer (ISSE) serves as a technical cybersecurity expert throughout the entire system development lifecycle, ensuring that mission‑essential systems comply with Department of Defense (DoD) and federal security standards. This position combines hands‑on engineering, secure architecture design, and compliance‑driven analysis to safeguard sensitive environments and support critical national security missions. The ISSE works closely with multidisciplinary teams to integrate security into system design from the earliest stages and to maintain a strong defensive posture throughout system operation. Their responsibility include:

• Develop and refine security architectures that align with DoD, Intelligence Community, and NIST cybersecurity frameworks, ensuring systems are designed with a robust security foundation.

• Lead all phases of the Risk Management Framework (RMF), including selecting appropriate security controls, guiding their implementation, supporting assessments, and managing ongoing monitoring and authorization activities.

• Conduct vulnerability identification and compliance assessments using ACAS (Assured Compliance Assessment Solution), while streamlining reporting processes and ensuring timely remediation of findings.

• Configure, integrate, and optimize FortiSIEM to support comprehensive log aggregation, correlation, alerting, and security event analysis in support of incident detection and response.

• Apply DISA Security Technical Implementation Guides (STIGs), Security Requirements Guides (SRGs), and other hardened baseline configurations to secure operating systems, applications, network appliances, and other system components.

• Prepare and maintain detailed cybersecurity documentation, including System Security Plans (SSPs), Plans of Action and Milestones (POA&Ms), Concept of Operations (CONOPS), and other required accreditation materials.

• Collaborate with system engineers, software developers, ISSOs, program managers, and other stakeholders to ensure that cybersecurity principles are incorporated into system design and operational processes.

• Provide technical expertise during security incidents by assisting with investigative activities, containment strategies, and engineering‑focused remediation efforts.


Compensation:

$52.40/hr to $60.10/hr.


Exact compensation may vary based on several factors, including skills, experience, and education.


Employees in this role will enjoy a comprehensive benefits package starting on day one of employment, including options for medical, dental, and vision insurance. Eligibility to enroll in the 401(k) retirement plan begins after 90 days of employment. Additionally, employees in this role will have access to paid sick leave and other paid time off benefits as required under the applicable law of the worksite location.

description:
Insight Global is looking to bring on a Top Secret cleared Cloud Systems Engineer to support a federal client of ours onsite in Charleston, SC. This individual is primarily responsible for technical alignment of cloud and on-premises subscribers to the CSSP. We are building and deploying the next-generation multi-cloud cybersecurity system for a Cyber Security Service Provider (CSSP) within the U.S. Department of Defense. Our cloud-native platform unifies cybersecurity monitoring and operations across Cloud Service Providers and on-premise environments. Our product team is delivering Day-0 and Day-1 operations ranging from provisioning infrastructure, deploying cyber tools, building custom integrations, to delivering real-time telemetry to a centralized hub for mission-aligned cyber defense.
As mission adoption grows, we are expanding our integration engineering team to ensure seamless, secure, and scalable onboarding of subscribers into this modernized cybersecurity ecosystem. This role is essential to bridging subscriber environments with CSSP services by delivering connectivity, deploying and validating security tools, and providing mission-ready configurations aligned with cyber defense objectives. Additional responsibilities are as follows:

• Serve as primary integration engineer for subscriber onboarding, ensuring infrastructure and tools are properly deployed, configured, and operational.
• Provision, configure, and secure network interfaces between multi-cloud service providers (primarily via AWS and Azure) and on-premise environments.
• Deploy, validate, and troubleshoot cybersecurity tools (Elastic, Zeek, Suricata, Tenable, Trellix, etc.) using Infrastructure-as-Code and Configuration-as-Code tooling (Terraform, Ansible, CI/CD pipelines).
• Integrate custom cyber sensors and telemetry configurations to support customer-specific data flows and mission requirements.
• Stand up secure data transport mechanisms (e.g., IPsec tunnels, VPNs, EventHub ingestion) from customer edge environments to the centralized core in AWS.
• Validate cybersecurity tool operations, ensuring telemetry is flowing, logs are populating, alerts are firing, and dashboards are live.
• Collaborate with engineering and mission enablement teams to ensure deployments are tailored and aligned with customer operational environments.
• Support customer onboarding engagements by advising on architecture, remediating integration issues, and ensuring compliance with customer requirements.
• Collaborate across internal teams to refine and improve integration and deployment procedures and toolkits.
• Ability to travel up to 25% of the time.

IG is looking for a linux engineer to join one of our clients in Camp Lejeune, North Carolina. In this role, the Linux Engineer provides subject matter expertise on the capabilities of Joint Live Virtual Constructive (JLVC) federate simulations and tools within the JLVC catalog to support specified training objectives. We are looking for someone with drive, talent, and experience in Embedded Systems and Controls who also thrives in a fast-paced, Research and Development (R&D) environment. The successful candidate will report to the Sr. Manager of High-Speed Digital and, alongside high-caliber staff, will be engaged in the engineering support and new development of high-power motor drives, power conditioning systems, high-energy laser systems, advanced aerospace and electro-optic sensors, space-based optical communications, nuclear thermal propulsion, cutting-edge technology ventures into Defense and “NewSpace,” and a variety of disruptive technologies. THis is fully onsite working 9/80.

REQUIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:
- Eligible to obtain a DOD Secret Clearance
-Bachelor's Degree with 12 years’ total professional work experience, Master's Degree with 10 years’ total professional work experience, PHD with 7 years total professional work experience
-Required Experience: Embedded systems development (processor, microcontroller, FPGA, and MPSoC); mixed-signal circuit design (analog/digital); analysis, design, and implementation of hardware systems to include digital, analog, RF, and optical is required.
-Desirable Experience: Embedded Systems development for complex, high-performance system-of-systems; embedded systems architecture and project development for Xilinx and/or Microsemi devices including Zynq Ultrascale+ MPSoCs and/or SmartFusion2 SoCs; VxWorks implemented on custom, high-requirement hardware; distributed, embedded Linux environments; National Instruments Labview instrumentation and controls development on cRIO devices, including FPGA-level, CPU/RTOS-level, and client-side GUI; familiarity with DoD technical review process (at a minimum: SRR, PDR, CDR, TRR).
-Desired Skills: Experience with Xilinx Vivado Design Suite, Xilinx Vitis Unified Software Platform, Microsemi Libero SoC Design Suite, bare-metal C-code programming, VxWorks, Linux, Buildroot, National Instruments LabVIEW, VHDL, C/C++, PADS or Altium PCB Design Software, Atlassian Tool Suite, Microsoft Project, Microsoft Visio, and Powerpoint.
-Demonstrate technical expertise and application of engineering principles, concepts, theory, and practice with the ability to organize, plan, schedule, conduct, and coordinate workloads to meet established deadlines or milestones with some experience in project leadership.

Qualifications and Experience:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Systems Engineering, or a related field.

Infrastructure as Code (Terraform)
Containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)
Cloud security implementation

Python, .NET C#, or other development languages
DevSecOps practices and tools
Microservices architecture

SAFe Agile methodologies

NICE TO HAVE SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
Responsible for developing the cloud service delivery models and architectural framework to enable Platform as a Service (PaaS), Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Software as a Service (SaaS), and Data as a Service (DaaS).
Implement automation for cloud resources using DevSecOps best practices.
Analyze applications and make recommendations across multiple areas to identify what platforms can move, migrate, and/or be deployed into a cloud environment.

Work independently designing and developing new software products or major enhancements to existing cloud software.
Enhance existing cloud software for performance and scalability.
Participate in Program Increments (PIs) and Agile Release Train (ART) activities.
Support the multi-enclave environment (Unclassified, Secret, and Top Secret).
Collaborate with infrastructure and development teams to ensure seamless integration.

A customer is seeking an experienced Senior Contracts Manager to join our team. This position requires knowledge and experience in executing contracts from negotiations, cradle-to-grave contract and subcontract management, and the application of government contracting methods and regulations, including but not limited to Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR), Defense Acquisition Regulations (DFARS), Air Force Acquisition Regulations (AFARS), and other agency supplements. The role requires strong business acumen, the ability to manage multiple contracts and subcontracts, and support proposals in accordance with company policies and customer requirements. This is a non-supervisory position.

Duties and responsibilities to include:
• Negotiate the Company’s contracts and subcontracts, participating in all aspects of the procurement process for services and products in support of business development, negotiation, and administration of contracts and subcontracts for government and commercial programs.
• Manage and actively participate in the overall contractual support (drafting, issuing, negotiating, and interpreting) of a wide range of contractual documents and agreements (prime contracts, teaming agreements, subcontracts, NDAs, and commercial agreements).
• Provide proposal support by reviewing solicitations, identifying risks, and offering proposal support regarding the contractual aspects of the solicitations.
• Research and interpret government regulations as they apply to the Company’s contracts, advising project managers and other company personnel on contractual obligations, risks, and compliance matters.
• Support project accounting functions regarding maintenance of contract and subcontractor files.
• Support ISO 9001/20000/27000 and CMMI annual requirements as needed.
• Prepare and submit deliverables to contracting offices, customers, and vendor partners as necessary and appropriate.
• Develop and maintain strong relationships with contracting office personnel and internal stakeholders.
• Participate in special projects as required, and perform other duties as assigned.

REQUIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:
• Bachelor's degree in a business field or related is required.
• Must have the ability to obtain and maintain a Security Clearance for future requirements.
• A minimum of seven (7) years of US Federal Government contract management experience including three (3) to five (5) years of subcontract management.
• Thorough general functional knowledge across a wide range of sub-disciplines within the individual’s specialty area(s) e.g. prime contracts, subcontracts, risk management, contract terms and conditions, contracts management and administration, negotiations, and understanding and utilization of best practices to include source selection and justification
• Working knowledge of the Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR), Defense FAR Supplement (DFARS), and other individual agency acquisition regulations.
• Strong teamwork skills and experience in building strong, positive, and collaborative working relationships with both Government contracting personnel and company program management personnel.
• Strong communications skills (written and oral).
• Self-driven, motivated, and results-oriented. Must be able to work independently on multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced team environment.
• Be a “team player.”
• Strong MS Office skills (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) for developing documents, spreadsheets, and presentations.
• Knowledge of monthly, quarterly, and annual contract reporting deliverables (ex. Small Business reporting).
• Ability to prioritize requirements and meet deadlines.
NICE TO HAVE SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
• A Certified Professional Contracts Manager (CPCM) certification or MBA or MS, Contracts is desired.
